title: Killer bee
data:

*For a list of all arthropods, see [list of arthropods](/List_of_arthropods "List of arthropods").*

|   | A giant bee, bearing a deadly barb which can sting repeatedly. |

## Useful Info

**Killer bees** are poisonous flying insects that live up to their name. They're twice as fast as most characters, attack in swarms, and can quickly inject fatal amounts of [poison](/Poison "Poison"). They are found in the mid-[Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"), as well as in "[hive](/Hive "Hive")" [vaults](/Vault "Vault") scattered around elsewhere.

## Tips & Tricks

- Never believe that there's just one bee on the floor - they always travel with friends. Try to use hallways if you can.

- With [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and decent [AC](/AC "AC"), a bee swarm is a nuisance. With only poison resistance, they can be a handful if they surround you. Without either, charging into melee is often suicide.

- Be extremely wary of [out of depth](/Out_of_depth "Out of depth") swarms of bees. It's almost certain death to fight a swarm on D:4, even if in a hallway. If possible, close [doors](/Door "Door") with **C** to keep them from reaching you.

- Later in the game, watch out for [queen bees](/Queen_bee "Queen bee"), who can [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") nearby killer bees. Even if you can [tab](/Tab "Tab") through regular bees, a dozen berserked bees can be a serious threat.

- The following are particularly effective against bee swarms:

  - [Poison](/Poison "Poison") attacks work wonders. [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud") will make a tightly-clumped swarm slaughter itself. [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance") will slaughter large bee rooms. A weapon of [venom](/Venom "Venom") can quickly kill if it hits, but due to their 18 EV, this isn't as reliable.
  - Bees have relatively low [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"), so a [wand of charming](/Wand_of_charming "Wand of charming") can be effective in turning some of them onto your side.
  - A [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") can give characters some much-needed AC and poison resistance, greatly reducing the threat of a pack of bees.
  - When things go badly, don't forget about your [potions of curing](/Potions_of_curing "Potions of curing").
html:
Killer bee

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all arthropods, see list of arthropods.

killer bee y 
HP 10-22
HD 3
XP 62
Speed 20
AC 2
EV 18
Will 10
Attack1 10 (sting: poison)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities Poison
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Tiny
Type killer bee, killer bee
Flags Flying
No skeleton
A giant bee, bearing a deadly barb which can sting repeatedly.

Useful Info

Killer bees are poisonous flying insects that live up to their name. They're twice as fast as most characters, attack in swarms, and can quickly inject fatal amounts of poison. They are found in the mid-Dungeon, as well as in "hive" vaults scattered around elsewhere.

Tips & Tricks

  • Never believe that there's just one bee on the floor - they always travel with friends. Try to use hallways if you can.
  • With poison resistance and decent AC, a bee swarm is a nuisance. With only poison resistance, they can be a handful if they surround you. Without either, charging into melee is often suicide.
  • Be extremely wary of out of depth swarms of bees. It's almost certain death to fight a swarm on D:4, even if in a hallway. If possible, close doors with C to keep them from reaching you.
  • Later in the game, watch out for queen bees, who can berserk nearby killer bees. Even if you can tab through regular bees, a dozen berserked bees can be a serious threat.
  • The following are particularly effective against bee swarms:
    • Poison attacks work wonders. Mephitic Cloud will make a tightly-clumped swarm slaughter itself. Olgreb's Toxic Radiance will slaughter large bee rooms. A weapon of venom can quickly kill if it hits, but due to their 18 EV, this isn't as reliable.
    • Bees have relatively low willpower, so a wand of charming can be effective in turning some of them onto your side.
    • A potion of lignification can give characters some much-needed AC and poison resistance, greatly reducing the threat of a pack of bees.
    • When things go badly, don't forget about your potions of curing.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Killer_bee&oldid=79804"

==Useful Info==
'''Killer bees''' are poisonous flying insects that live up to their name. They're twice as fast as most characters, attack in swarms, and can quickly inject fatal amounts of [[poison]]. They are found in the mid-[[Dungeon]], as well as in "[[hive]]" [[vault]]s scattered around elsewhere.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Never believe that there's just one bee on the floor - they always travel with friends. Try to use hallways if you can.
*With [[poison resistance]] and decent [[AC]], a bee swarm is a nuisance. With only poison resistance, they can be a handful if they surround you. Without either, charging into melee is often suicide.
*Be extremely wary of [[out of depth]] swarms of bees. It's almost certain death to fight a swarm on D:4, even if in a hallway. If possible, close [[door]]s with '''C''' to keep them from reaching you.
*Later in the game, watch out for [[queen bee]]s, who can [[berserk]] nearby killer bees. Even if you can [[tab]] through regular bees, a dozen berserked bees can be a serious threat.
*The following are particularly effective against bee swarms:
**[[Poison]] attacks work wonders. [[Mephitic Cloud]] will make a tightly-clumped swarm slaughter itself. [[Olgreb's Toxic Radiance]] will slaughter large bee rooms. A weapon of [[venom]] can quickly kill if it hits, but due to their 18 EV, this isn't as reliable.
**Bees have relatively low [[willpower]], so a [[wand of charming]] can be effective in turning some of them onto your side.
**A [[potion of lignification]] can give characters some much-needed AC and poison resistance, greatly reducing the threat of a pack of bees.
**When things go badly, don't forget about your [[potions of curing]].
